h1.style: font-family: gotham-black; color: white; font-size: 58px; line-height: 39px;

div.p: We have a right fit for every family

All CVUSD schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
For more information, please visit conejousd.org/coronavirus

Download the CVUSD Mobile App, and follow the District’s
official social media pages for updates & information.

div.div: We have a right fit for every family

h1.style: font-family: gotham-bold; font-size: 28px; margin-bottom: 5px; color: #7fd2ff; line-height: 40px;

div.h1:
Conejo Valley Unified School District’s School Choice Application
and Interdistrict Transfer Application are now open
for the 2020-2021 academic year.

div.style: background: #f4c843; border-radius: 10px; padding: 11px; font-family: gotham-bold; font-size: 24px; display: inline-block; vertical-align: top; margin-top: 18px;

a.style: color: #1b3a4b; text-shadow: white 1px 1px; font-weight: bold; text-decoration: none;

div.p: We believe ALL students deserve an exceptional educational experience filled with opportunity and choices. At CVUSD we have a right fit for every family and we believe each child has unique gifts to discover. Our schools are positive, safe and inviting learning environments. We believe in a partnership between the community, parents, students and faculty. Doing things, “The Conejo Way,” ensures ideal academic outcomes for our students as we use teamwork, relationship building, trust and accountability to together lead the way into a bright future. We will nurture your child’s passions - “The Conejo Way!”

div.span: Conejo Valley Unified School District is immensely proud of the graduating class of 2020. Our high school seniors have worked their whole academic careers towards high school culmination, and this week we are shining a light on them in a few special ways.

div.a: CVUSD Health Safety Tips and Information Related to Coronavirus

img.alt: CVUSD Health Safety Tips and Information Related to Coronavirus

h2.a: CVUSD Health Safety Tips and Information Related to Coronavirus

div.span: We want to assure you that CVUSD is actively monitoring coronavirus/COVID-19 and taking steps to maintain safe learning environments for our students and staff. We are working closely with the Ventura County Office of Education and Ventura County Public Health to stay abreast of important information and procedures. In line with these partnerships, and our commitment to the overall health and well-being of the community we serve, we share the following information with you...

div.a: A Message of Gratitude from CVUSD Superintendent Dr. Mark McLaughlin Before Spring Break

img.alt: A Message of Gratitude from CVUSD Superintendent Dr. Mark McLaughlin Before Spring Break

h2.a: A Message of Gratitude from CVUSD Superintendent Dr. Mark McLaughlin Before Spring Break

div.span: Over the last month we have endured tremendous change. As a community our resilience has been nothing short of inspirational, and I am endlessly proud to be the Superintendent of this phenomenal school district.

div.a: CVUSD Superintendent, Two Principals & Two Administrators Receive Recognition from ACSA

img.alt: CVUSD Superintendent, Two Principals & Two Administrators Receive Recognition from ACSA

h2.a: CVUSD Superintendent, Two Principals & Two Administrators Receive Recognition from ACSA

article.div: Annually, the Association of California School Administrators (ACSA) honors individuals for their work in school leadership. Through our local region, members nominate candidates that showcase the core values of ACSA: leadership, service, unity and diversity, continuous improvement, and enjoyment. We are proud to share the following members of the CVUSD team received recognition for the 2019-2020 school year...

div.a: Generations Unite Club of Westlake High School Provides Opportunity to Spread Joy & Community Connection

img.alt: Generations Unite Club of Westlake High School Provides Opportunity to Spread Joy & Community Connection

h2.a: Generations Unite Club of Westlake High School Provides Opportunity to Spread Joy & Community Connection

article.div: Forming a connection, sharing encouragement, and spreading joy to others is at the center of the new project from Generations Unite, a student club at Westlake High School. As part of their, "Hope Notes" project, the club is putting a call out to the community to share drawings, pictures, or handwritten letters that may be digitally delivered to residents of local senior homes.
